DataElement.preferredName: Autoimmune Disease Other Personal Medical History Descriptive Text
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Text to describe any autoimmune disease diagnosed by a physician within a patient that is different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Autoimmune Disease Disease Other Personal Medical History
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A condition in which the body recognizes its own tissues as foreign and directs an immune response against them._The term is often used broadly to include injuries, disabilities, syndromes, symptoms, deviant behaviors, and atypical variations of structure and function._Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned._ An account of all medical events and problems a person has experienced.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A condition in which the body recognizes its own tissues as foreign and directs an immune response against them.:A definite pathologic process with a characteristic set of signs and symptoms. It may affect the whole body or any of its parts, and its etiology, pathology, and prognosis may be known or unknown.

Concepts.definition: A disorder resulting from loss of function or tissue destruction of an organ or multiple organs, arising from humoral or cellular immune responses of the individual to his own tissue constituents. It may be systemic (e.g., systemic lupus erythematosus), or organ specific, (e.g., thyroiditis).

Any abnormal condition of the body or mind that causes discomfort, dysfunction, or distress to the person affected or those in contact with the person. The term is often used broadly to include injuries, disabilities, syndromes, symptoms, deviant behaviors, and atypical variations of structure and function.

Property.preferredDefinition: Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.:A record of a patient's background regarding health and the occurrence of disease events of the individual.  In addition, personal medical history may be a variable in epidemiologic studies.

Concepts.definition: Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.
A record of a patient's background regarding health and the occurrence of disease events of the individual. In addition, personal medical history may be a variable in epidemiologic studies.
